review: This worked perfectly since April - I'd been telling all my friends that it's so great that I ended up canceling my regular cable since my 5- and 4-year-old are able to watch whatever they want through our subscriptions via the Amazon Fire TV. Then just this morning it no longer connected to WiFi and had the error message, "Connected with Problems." I even tried connecting my internet cable directly as Amazon Tech Support instructed me to and that didn't work. I had downloaded the Pandora and a couple of other music apps last night, so not sure if that has anything to do with it, though I don't see why it should. There was nothing else that was done to the Amazon Fire TV from one day to the next when it no longer worked. So far Tech Support has been unable to help me and I'm still waiting for a call back to get this resolved.There is no current fix on the Amazon.com troubleshooting page. PLEASE HELP
author: Amazon Customer

review: This device is very easy to set up (just plug it in), and the screen display, voice search, and remote control make it extremely easy to use. I have a Tivo and a Chromecast, so I was already well wired with internet television. The main reason I bought the Fire TV was to get access to Amazon Prime video and to Showtime Anytime. Well, Amazon Prime is awesome, but I was extremely disappointed that my cable provider, Charter, was not among the supported cable providers. I was almost thinking of returning the device, but I quickly got hooked on its ease of use -- so, so, so much easier than Chromecast, and so, so much faster than my Tivo, which is bogged down by a slow internet adapter. So, I decided to keep it, and I find myself using it all the time. Well done, Amazon; I know the Charter glitch is not your fault.
author: Amazon Customer
